meanings.definition: A collective farm in the former Soviet Union.
meanings.sent1: The kolkhozes in the village worked together to grow crops.
meanings.sent2: During the Soviet era, many farmers belonged to kolkhozes.
meanings.sent3: The kolkhozes decided to have a friendly competition to see who could harvest the most potatoes.
meanings.sent4: The kolkhozes stood like a united force against the challenges of nature.
meanings.sent5: The image of the kolkhozes toiling in the fields under the sun was etched in their memories.

meanings.definition: The system of collective farms in the former Soviet Union.
meanings.sent1: People relied on the kolkhozes for their food supply.
meanings.sent2: The kolkhozes were an essential part of the agricultural structure in the Soviet Union.
meanings.sent3: The kolkhozes had a meeting to discuss the upcoming harvest season.
meanings.sent4: The kolkhozes symbolized unity and cooperation among farmers.
meanings.sent5: The concept of kolkhozes revolutionized farming practices in the region.
